About.Name: Gideon Seyoum
About.AboutText: Hi, I am Gideon Seyoum. I am an electrical engineering student with a passion for practical, hands-on innovation that solves real-world problems. My experience spans from working with DDC controls and automation systems at Albireo Energy, to building circuits and integrating sensors for a beach-cleaning robot and a BAJA SAE vehicle.

This is a good spot to talk yourself up.
Experience.EducationText: Use this to add some narrative to your education section
Experience.EmploymentText: Use this to add some narrative to your employment section
Experience.SkillsText: I have a strong foundation in programming and electrical engineering, with hands-on experience using tools like MATLAB, Simulink, and Altium for real-world projects. Whether it's circuit simulation, embedded systems development, or PCB design, I enjoy combining software and hardware to solve complex engineering problems. I'm also comfortable working across multiple IDEs and engineering platforms to bring ideas to life efficiently and effectively.

Project1.Title: Interesting Project 1
Project1.Desc:
This is a description of Project One.

It has a GitHub repo and more details shown in screenshots.

Project2.Title: Power Flow Analysis Using PSCAD/EMTDC and MATLAB
Project2.Description: Analyzed a 3-bus power system using PSCAD for simulation and MATLAB for numerical methods (Gauss-Seidel, Newton-Raphson). Built a controllable 3-phase source system in PSCAD and integrated real-time control panels. Compared iterative methods for power flow, incorporated line shunt capacitances, and evaluated system performance based on voltage, power flow, and convergence behavior.

Project3.Title: Dual Adjustable Power Supply with Multiple Output Levels
Project3.Description: Designed, simulated, and tested a dual adjustable power supply with six output levels. Utilized full-wave rectification, voltage regulation (LM317, LM337, UA7912, UA7805), and operational amplifiers to create ±1.5–19V, ±12V, +5V, and 0–10V outputs. Validated circuit through Multisim simulations, breadboard prototyping, and PCB implementation. Emphasized modular stage design with protective inputs, filtering, and real-time voltage adjustment.
